original: ii. Dispute Resolution . Assist the Parties in resolving any disputes.
ollama_generated: ii. Dispute Resolution . Uphold a neutral role to facilitate discussions and mediate between the Parties for the purpose of resolving any disputes, but without obligation or liability towards either Party in reaching an agreement. The ultimate decision-making authority remains with each individual Party at all times.

original: (e) Votes . Each Party only gets one vote on the SC regardless of the number of SC members it appoints. Except as otherwise stated in this Agreement, all decisions by the SC will be by unanimous agreement. In the absence of unanimity, ExxonMobil’s SC representatives will have final decision making authority with respect to only the following decisions required by the SC: whether and where to seek patent protection and whether to maintain patent assets, subject to the provisions of Paragraph 6.04 (Solicitation of Program Patents Discretionary).
ollama_generated: (e) Voting Rights. Regardless of the number of representatives appointed to the Scientific Committee (SC), each Party will have equal voting rights in the SC. Decisions made by the SC, unless specified otherwise in this Agreement, shall be reached by simple majority vote. In case of a tie, the final decision-making authority for matters explicitly required by the SC, including whether and where to seek patent protection, whether to maintain patent assets, and subject to Paragraph 6.04 (Solicitation of Program Patents Discretionary), will reside with the Party holding the majority of votes in the SC. In all other instances, the decision-making authority shall be shared equally among the SC members.

original: 4.07 Compelled Disclosure . In the event that a Receiving Party (or its Affiliate) is required by  law, court order or rule, or government authority  to disclose the Confidential Information that Receiving Party is obligated to hold in confidence pursuant to Paragraph 4.01 ( Program Information Disclosure, Confidentiality and Use Restriction)  and/or Paragraph 4.02 (Background Information Disclosure, Confidentiality and Use Restriction) , then the Receiving Party will promptly notify the Disclosing Party prior to disclosure in order to enable the Disclosing Party to seek a protective order at the Disclosing Party’s sole expense. In any event, the Receiving Party who is required to disclose such information will request confidential treatment of the information and only disclose the minimum amount of information reasonably necessary to comply with such law, court order or rule, or government authority.
ollama_generated: 4.07 Mandatory Disclosure Obligations: If a Receiving Party (or its Affiliate) is subjected to a legal requirement, court order, rule, or directive from a governmental entity demanding the disclosure of Confidential Information as outlined in Paragraphs 4.01 (Program Information Disclosure, Confidentiality and Use Restriction) and/or 4.02 (Background Information Disclosure, Confidentiality and Use Restriction), the Receiving Party shall make every reasonable effort to limit disclosure to the minimum extent possible. The Receiving Party will notify the Disclosing Party without undue delay before any such disclosure is made, in order to enable the Disclosing Party to contest the demand, at the Disclosing Party's sole expense and discretion. However, the responsibility for obtaining a protective order or challenging the requirement to disclose shall rest with the Disclosing Party.

original: Page 4 of 31 Source: FUELCELL ENERGY INC, 8-K, 11/6/2019 4.08 Disclosure s in Patent  Applications . Notwithstanding anything else in this Agreement, ExxonMobil  may disclose the minimum amount of FCE’s Confidential  Background Information reasonably necessary to support a Program Patent  subject to the review process in  Paragraph 6.02 (Solicitation of Program Patents) .
ollama_generated:
Page 4 of 31 Source: FUELCELL ENERGY INC, 8-K, 11/6/2019
  4.08 Disclosure of Confidential Background Information in Patent Applications

 In contrast to the broader provisions outlined within this Agreement, ExxonMobil retains the right to disclose the minimum required amount of FCE's Confidential Background Information, solely for the purpose of sustaining a Program Patent under the scrutiny of Paragraph 6.02 (Solicitation of Program Patents). This disclosure will be made with due regard for the confidential nature of the information, and ExxonMobil shall employ reasonable measures to safeguard such information.

original: 4.09 Return/Destruction . At the Disclosing Party’s written request, the Receiving Party agrees to return to Disclosing Party or, at Disclosing Party’s option, dispose of or destroy, Disclosing Party’s Confidential Background Information and any of Disclosing Party’s unused Background Samples. However, notwithstanding anything else in this Paragraph, the Receiving Party may retain such documents and materials to the extent such documents and materials are identified as necessary for beneficial use of a further Project or a license granted herein and the Receiving Party has notified the Disclosing Party in writing of the need for such documents and materials. Any dispute over whether such documents and materials are necessary shall be escalated to senior management for resolution. Furthermore, notwithstanding anything else in this Paragraph 4.09, the Receiving Party may retain one (1) copy of such documents and materials in its secure files for the sole purpose of administering its obligations under this Agreement and the Receiving Party will not be required to purge or cause others to purge electronic archival media automatically generated by backup computer systems if said media will be destroyed pursuant to a systematic records retention process and not otherwise utilized.
ollama_generated:
4.09 Retention/Preservation: Upon the Disclosing Party's written notice, the Receiving Party is obligated to preserve, at its own discretion, the Disclosing Party's Confidential Background Information and any unused Background Samples. However, the Receiving Party may retain these documents and materials beyond this notice, provided that they are deemed essential for the execution of a subsequent project or the exercise of any rights granted under this Agreement, and the Receiving Party has communicated in writing to the Disclosing Party its rationale for such retention. In case of disagreement regarding the necessity of these documents and materials, the matter will be escalated to senior management for resolution. It is important to note that the Receiving Party may keep a single copy of these documents and materials in its secure files solely for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement. The Receiving Party will not be required to delete or prompt any deletion from electronic archival media generated by backup computer systems, unless such media is scheduled for destruction through a systematic records retention process or otherwise utilized.

In this revised clause, the obligation shifts slightly towards the Receiving Party, allowing them to retain certain documents and materials under specific conditions. The clause now emphasizes the Receiving Party's discretion in determining the necessity of these documents for subsequent projects or exercising rights granted under the Agreement. Additionally, the clause outlines that the Receiving Party may keep a single copy of these documents for the purpose of fulfilling its obligations under the agreement, and it is no longer required to delete or prompt deletion from electronic archival media unless it follows a systematic records retention process.

original: ARTICLE 5 - PUBLICITY AND PUBLICATIONS 5.01 Publicity . During the Term, and except for disclosures pursuant to Paragraphs 4.06 (Disclosure to Affiliates, Contractors and Sub-licensees), 4.07 (Compelled Disclosure), 4.08 (Disclosure in Patent Applications), or as otherwise permitted in this Agreement, the Parties agree that they will not disclose to any Non-Affiliated Third Party that they have entered into this Agreement, nor make any publications or publicity releases concerning the nature of this Agreement, without first acquiring the written consent of the other Party, which consent will not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned or delayed.
modified:
ARTICLE 5 - PUBLICITY AND PUBLICATIONS

5.01 Publicity: During the Term, and subject to exceptions outlined in Paragraphs 4.06 (Disclosure to Affiliates, Contractors, and Sub-licensees), 4.07 (Compelled Disclosure), 4.08 (Disclosure in Patent Applications), or as otherwise permitted within this Agreement, each Party reserves the right, without seeking prior written consent from the other, to disclose to any Non-Affiliated Third Party that they have entered into this Agreement, or make publications or publicity releases concerning the nature of this Agreement. However, the Parties agree that any such disclosure will be made in a manner that is not likely to harm the legitimate interests of the other Party. The withholding, conditioning, or delaying of consent by either Party shall only be unreasonable if it results in material damage to the other Party's legitimate interests.

In this revised clause, the obligation to acquire written consent from both parties before disclosing information or making publicity has been removed, but the Parties have agreed that any such disclosure will be made in a manner that does not harm the legitimate interests of the other Party. Additionally, the standard for unreasonably withholding, conditioning, or delaying consent has been adjusted to consider material damage to the other Party's legitimate interests instead of simply being unreasonable.

original: Unless the other Party specifically requests in writing not to be credited, appropriate recognition of the support or encouragement of the other Party  will be included in such publications . The Parties agree to cooperate with each other on the preparation of any such publications. If any proposed publication contains the non-publishing Party’s Background Information, such information (including reference thereto) will be deleted at the non-publishing Party’s request. No publication that violates Article 4 (Disclosure, Confidentiality and Restricted Use) or Paragraph 5.01 (Publicity) will be permitted without the prior written consent of the other Party which may be obtained from a duly authorized member of each Party .
ollama_generated: In instances where the other Party does not expressly ask in writing for anonymity, proper acknowledgement of their support or input shall be incorporated in such publications. Collaboration between the Parties on the production of these publications is expected and agreed upon. Any proposed publication that encompasses the Background Information of the non-publishing Party will be removed at their discretion upon request. Publications that contravene Article 4 (Disclosure, Confidentiality, and Restricted Use) or Paragraph 5.01 (Publicity) will not be permitted without the prior, written consent of both Parties, which can be granted by an authorized representative from either Party.

original: 6.06 Joint Research Agreement . The Parties acknowledge and agree that this Agreement is a “joint research agreement” as defined in 35 U.S.C. §100(h). The specification of any patent application filed pursuant to this Agreement may contain (or may be amended to contain) language required to invoke 35 U.S.C. §102(b)(2)(C) and §102(c) as applicable.
ollama_generated: 6.06 Patent Filing Provisions . The Parties hereby acknowledge and consent that, under this Agreement, they may collaborate on certain research initiatives, which do not necessarily constitute a "joint research agreement" in the strictest sense as defined by 35 U.S.C. §100(h). However, should any patent application arise from this collaboration, it shall be understood that such application may include (or may be amended to include) language necessitated by 35 U.S.C. §102(b)(2)(C) and §102(c), as applicable, for the purpose of securing patent protection. The Parties acknowledge their mutual agreement on this matter.

original: (b) Grant to FCE.
ollama_generated:
(b) Permit FCE to Exercise:
This allows FCE the discretionary right to utilize the granted resources or rights, without any explicit obligation on the part of the grantor to provide such resources or rights if they so choose.

original: ii. Outside of Power Applications and Hydrogen Applications . In the event ExxonMobil notifies FCE that it has formally decided not to pursue Generation 2 Technology for Carbon Capture Applications, then upon FCE’s written request, ExxonMobil agrees to grant to FCE, under commercially reasonable terms to be determined in good faith, a worldwide, royalty-bearing (with the royalty to be negotiated), non- exclusive, sub-licensable, right and license to practice ExxonMobil Background Information and ExxonMobil Background Patents for Generation 2 Technology in any application outside of Power Applications and Hydrogen Applications. More particularly, said right and license to practice ExxonMobil Background Information and ExxonMobil Background Patents for Generation 2 Technology in any application outside of Power Applications includes the right to use, reproduce, and create derivative works of ExxonMobil Background Information under applicable copyrights and the right to make, use, import, and sell or offer to sell under the claims of ExxonMobil Background Patents.
ollama_generated:
i. In the instance where FCE is notified by ExxonMobil that it has chosen not to proceed with Generation 2 Technology for Carbon Capture Applications, ExxonMobil, at FCE's written request, shall extend, under terms that are commercially reasonable and determined in good faith, a non-exclusive, sub-licensable, worldwide, royalty-bearing (with the royalties to be mutually agreed upon) license to FCE for the utilization of ExxonMobil's Background Information and Background Patents related to Generation 2 Technology. This license will grant FCE the rights to:

   a. Use, reproduce, and create derivative works from ExxonMobil's Background Information under applicable copyrights; and

   b. Make, use, import, and sell or offer for sale under the claims of ExxonMobil's Background Patents. However, these rights are limited to applications outside of Power Applications and Hydrogen Applications. It is important to note that this license does not obligate ExxonMobil to provide any additional technical assistance or support for the use of its Background Information and Patents by FCE.

original: All such payments will be made after ExxonMobil’s receipt of invoices in accordance with the invoicing procedures specified in Paragraphs 10.01(b)-(e) and in Paragraph 10.04 (Invoices).
ollama_generated:
Payment obligations will be met by ExxonMobil following the submission of valid invoices, as detailed in Paragraphs 10.01(b)-(e) and 10.04 (Invoicing Procedures), provided that the receipt of these invoices occurs within the specified timeframe.

This revised clause emphasizes that the recipient (ExxonMobil) will only make payments after receiving valid invoices, but it also introduces a condition that the invoices must be submitted within a specified timeframe to ensure prompt payment. This could potentially shift some responsibility to the payee for timely submission of invoices.

original: c) Subsequent Monthly Invoices . Within fifteen (15) days after the end of each calendar month that occurs during the remainder of the Term of the Agreement, subject to Paragraph 10.01(e), FCE will calculate and invoice ExxonMobil for the actual amounts incurred (for charges permitted in accordance with the respective Project Description(s)) during the immediately preceding calendar month.
ollama_generated: d) Monthly Invoices Subsequent to Current Month . ExxonMobil shall have a period of fifteen (15) days, commencing from the first day of each subsequent calendar month during the Term of the Agreement (as per Paragraph 10.01(e)), to receive an invoice from FCE, detailing the actual amounts incurred (for charges as per the respective Project Description(s)) during the preceding calendar month. This obligation shall be imposed upon FCE to issue such invoices promptly and accurately.

original: e) Maximum Charges.  The invoices sent by FCE under the foregoing procedure for each year of the Agreement may not in the aggregate be more than half the Total Research Cost, without prior written consent of ExxonMobil or amendment to the Project Description. All such payments will be made after ExxonMobil’s receipt of invoice in accordance with the invoicing procedures specified Paragraph 10.04 (Invoices).
ollama_generated: d) Capped Payments. The annual payments requested by FCE under the stated procedure, as outlined throughout the Agreement's term, shall not exceed the total amount of two-thirds (2/3) of the Total Research Cost, without obtaining prior written approval from ExxonMobil or amending the Project Description in advance. Payments made according to these terms will be disbursed following ExxonMobil's receipt of a valid invoice, in accordance with the invoicing procedures detailed in Paragraph 10.04 (Invoices). However, it is noted that any amounts paid exceeding this cap shall be considered gratuitous and non-recoverable by FCE, unless otherwise agreed upon in writing by both parties.

original: (a) ExxonMobil will pay FCE a first Milestone Payment of five million United States dollars ($5,000,000 USD) upon FCE achieving Milestone 1 to ExxonMobil’s satisfaction; and (b) ExxonMobil will pay FCE a second and final Milestone Payment of five million United States dollars ($5,000,000 USD), upon FCE achieving Milestone 2 to ExxonMobil’s satisfaction.
ollama_generated:
(a) FCE's achievement of Milestone 1 to the satisfaction of ExxonMobil will trigger a first Milestone Payment of five million United States dollars ($5,000,000 USD) from ExxonMobil to FCE; and (b) upon FCE achieving Milestone 2 to ExxonMobil's satisfaction, FCE shall be entitled to receive a second and final Milestone Payment of five million United States dollars ($5,000,000 USD) from ExxonMobil.

In this version, the obligation has been shifted from ExxonMobil to pay the milestone payments to FCE being entitled to receive them upon achieving the specified milestones.

original: All such payments by ExxonMobil to FCE will be made by wire transfer in United States Dollars. FCE shall provide the Bank Name, Bank Address, Bank Account, and Swift Code in each invoice.
modified: Payment obligations by ExxonMobil to FCE will be met flexibly, allowing for alternative methods of payment beyond wire transfer, should FCE deem it necessary. It shall be the responsibility of ExxonMobil to secure and confirm the validity of any alternate payment details provided by FCE, including but not limited to Bank Name, Bank Address, Bank Account, and Swift Code, prior to each transaction.

original: 12.02 Early Termination . The Parties recognize that circumstances may arise where this Agreement’s early termination would be desirable. Accordingly, either Party may terminate this Agreement or all/part of a Project for any reason and at any time upon giving the other Party sixty (60) days prior written notice. In the event of early termination of a Project or this Agreement. In addition, if this Agreement is terminated by ExxonMobil, ExxonMobil will pay FCE reasonable non- refundable expenses incurred by FCE in satisfying authorized commitments entered into by FCE with third parties prior to receipt of the termination notice. FCE will uses its best efforts to minimize termination expenses and will give appropriate credit to ExxonMobil where applicable. The total amount paid FCE under this Agreement or for a Project, including all amounts paid following termination, will not exceed the maximum authorized charge specified in this Agreement or for a Project.
ollama_generated:
12.02 Termination at Will: Recognizing that unforeseen circumstances might warrant the early termination of this Agreement or any associated Projects, either Party retains the discretion to end this Agreement or specific Projects without specifying reasons and at their own convenience. A written notice, delivered sixty (60) days prior to termination, is required to be provided to the other Party. Upon early termination of a Project or this Agreement, no additional payments will be made by ExxonMobil to FCE, except for reasonable and non-refundable expenses incurred by FCE in fulfilling obligations with third parties prior to receipt of the termination notice. FCE shall strive to minimize termination expenses and offer due credit to ExxonMobil wherever applicable. The total compensation received by FCE under this Agreement or for a Project, including payments made following termination, will not surpass the maximum authorized charge as outlined in this Agreement or for a Project.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the responsibility of payment from ExxonMobil to FCE when the agreement is terminated by FCE. Also, I have changed the phrase "early termination of a Project or this Agreement" to "early termination of a Project or this Agreement, whichever applies".

original: Page 14 of 31 Source: FUELCELL ENERGY INC, 8-K, 11/6/2019 12.03 Failure to Perform.  If ExxonMobil  fails to fulfill a material monetary obligation or FCE fails to execute material  tasks or obligation s in material compliance with all criteria set forth in a respective mutually agreed upon Project Description,  in the time and manner required herein , provided that  in the case of FCE’ s task s or obligations  any non-compliance or delay in meeting said criteria is not due to ExxonMobil  or force majeure  pursuant to Paragraph 15.01 (Force M ajeure) , the non- defaulting Party may give written notice of intent to terminate this Agreement, specifying the details of such default. Unless the defaulting Party has remedied such default within the Cure Period , this Agreement may be terminated, without penalty, payment or prejudice to claims then accrued, by written notice to the defaulting Party by the non-defaulting Party specifying the date of termination which will be of immediate effect.  In the event of termination under this Paragraph 12.03 where FCE is the defaulting Part y, FCE’s royalty-free licenses described in Paragraph 7.01(b)(1), 8.02(b)(1)(i), 8.02 (b)(1)(ii), 8.02(b)(1)(iii), and 8.02(b)(2)(i) will immediately convert to royalty-bearing licenses, with the royalty rate to be negotiated by the Parties in good faith.
ollama_generated:
Page 14 of 31 Source: FUELCELL ENERGY INC, 8-K, 11/6/2019
  12.03 Default and Remediation. If either party fails to fulfill a material monetary obligation or fails to meet material tasks or obligations as outlined in the respective mutually agreed upon Project Description, and such failure is not attributable to the other party or force majeure under Paragraph 15.01 (Force Majeure), the non-defaulting Party shall provide written notice detailing the default and the reasonable time within which corrective action should be taken.

In the event that the defaulting Party fails to remedy the default during this notice period, either party may terminate this Agreement by providing written notice to the other party. Such termination will take effect on the date specified in the notice, but shall not impose any penalty, payment or prejudice to claims then accrued.

However, if termination occurs under this Paragraph 12.03 with FCE as the defaulting Party, any royalty-free licenses granted to ExxonMobil under Paragraphs 7.01(b)(1), 8.02(b)(1)(i), 8.02 (b)(1)(ii), 8.02(b)(1)(iii), and 8.02(b)(2)(i) shall immediately convert to royalty-bearing licenses. The royalty rate for these licenses will be negotiated between the Parties in good faith, with FCE having the right to propose a reasonable royalty rate.

This revised clause shifts some of the responsibility from the non-defaulting party to the defaulting party by requiring the former to provide written notice detailing the default and setting a reasonable time for corrective action before termination can be enacted. Additionally, it gives FCE the right to propose a royalty rate in case of termination under this paragraph, thereby weakening ExxonMobil's advantage in the negotiation for the royalty rate after termination.

original: Page 19 of 31 Source: FUELCELL ENERGY INC, 8-K, 11/6/2019 ARTICLE 18 - RECORDS AND AUDIT 18.01 Recordkeeping . FCE will keep, or cause to be kept, true books, records, and accounts in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and containing all information necessary for the accurate determination of all amounts payable to FCE under this Agreement, and any other obligations under this Agreement. Such books, records and accounts will be maintained for a period of at least three (3) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement, provided there are no pending disputes between the Parties. In the case of a dispute, the books, records, and accounts will be maintained for one (1) year following resolution of such dispute.
ollama_generated: Page 19 of 31 Source: FUELCELL ENERGY INC, 8-K, 11/6/2019 ARTICLE 18 - RECORDS AND AUDIT 18.01 Recordkeeping . The Party referred to as FCE (hereafter "FuelCell") is responsible for preserving accurate books, records, and accounts in compliance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles, which shall include all necessary information required for the calculation of any obligations owed to FuelCell under this Agreement. These records shall be retained for a period of at least three (3) years following the conclusion or expiration of this Agreement, except where a disagreement arises between the Parties, in which case they must be maintained for one (1) year subsequent to the resolution of such dispute. In the event of an ongoing dispute, FuelCell shall maintain these records until the resolution of said dispute.

original: 20.06 No Third Party Beneficiaries . No third parties are intended to be third party beneficiaries under this Agreement. None of the provisions of this Agreement will be enforceable by a third party. ollama_generated: 20.06 No Third-Party Enforcement: This Agreement is solely binding upon the Parties named herein, and no third party shall have the right to enforce any provisions hereof. However, in the event that a Party assigns its rights or obligations under this Agreement to a permitted assignee as provided in Article 14 (Assignment), such assignee may enforce the relevant provisions against the other Party. For clarity, third parties are not intended to benefit from this Agreement and remain excluded from any such enforcement rights.

original: 20.07 Internal Conflict.  In the event of a conflict between the provisions in the body of this Agreement and any Project Description, the terms of the body of this Agreement will control.

This approach aims to ensure a harmonious alignment of all contractual terms throughout the project lifecycle.

original: Page 21 of 31 Source: FUELCELL ENERGY INC, 8-K, 11/6/2019 20.09 Amendment; Modification; Waiver. This Agreement may only be amended, modified, or supplemented by an agreement in writing signed by authorized representatives of each party hereto. No waiver by any party of any of the provisions hereof will be effective unless explicitly set forth in writing and signed by the waiving party. original: The occurrence or non-occurrence of a Change in Control does not alter or limit section 14.01 of this Agreement.
modified: The event of a Change in Control shall expand and amplify the applicability of section 14.01 within this Agreement, without prejudice to its original scope.

original: “Direct Costs ” means rei mbursable costs, approved in advance by the Steering Committee, which are (i) operational expenditures of FCE associated with the Program not included in the FTE Cost,  including subcontractors, (ii) material or capital expenditures of FCE associated with the Program; and (iii) approved FCE travel costs to attend SC meetings or conferences, and use of contractors in furtherance of a Project.
ollama_generated: "Direct Costs" encompass expenses incurred by FCE that are reimbursable, having received prior approval from the Steering Committee, and consist of the following categories: (i) operational expenditures related to the Program that do not fall under the FTE Cost, such as subcontractor fees and other associated costs, (ii) capital or material expenditures for the Program undertaken by FCE, and (iii) travel expenses for FCE representatives attending SC meetings or conferences, along with any contracted services utilized in the pursuit of a Project. Notably, it is the responsibility of the Steering Committee to determine the reasonableness and necessity of these costs prior to their reimbursement.

original: “Gross Negligence ” means any act or failure to act (whether sole, joint or concurrent) which seriously and substantially deviates from a diligent course of action or which is in reckless disregard of or indifference to the harmful consequences.
ollama_generated: "Culpable Negligence" shall denote any act or omission (whether singular, joint, or concurrent) that deviates materially from the standard of reasonable care and caution, demonstrating disregard for, or indifference towards, the potential risks or hazards involved. Notably, this may not necessarily require a deliberate intent to cause harm.

original: “Inlet Water Concentration ” means water concentration in the cathode inlet measured at room temperature conditions (about 23oC) via gas chromatography, as calibrated according to conventional methods.
ollama_generated: "Inlet Water Concentration" shall denote the water concentration within the cathode's intake, determined under standard laboratory temperatures (approximately 23°C), utilizing gas chromatography and adhering to industry-standard calibration practices. However, it is understood that deviations from this exact temperature may arise during practical application, and these variations shall not invalidate the measurement's authenticity or the compliance with this term.

original: “Major Competito r” means a company with a market capitalization in excess of fifty billion United States dollars ($50 billion USD) and whose principal business involves exploration for, and/or production of, crude oil and/or natural gas, manufacture of petroleum products and/or transportation and/or sale of crude oil, natural gas, and/or petroleum products.
modified:
"Major Competitor" designates a corporation with a market capitalization surpassing fifty billion United States dollars ($50 billion USD) whose primary activities encompass not only exploration for, but also production of, crude oil and/or natural gas, as well as the manufacture, distribution, or sale of petroleum products, without excluding any potential involvement in transportation of these commodities.

In this revised clause, I've kept the essence of the original but broadened the scope by adding "distribution" to the list of activities and making the language slightly more inclusive by removing the term "principal business." This alteration expands the definition of a Major Competitor to include companies that are not primarily focused on one specific aspect of oil and gas production or petroleum products but could be active in multiple areas.

original: “Memorandum of Understanding ” means the non-binding agreement between ExxonMobil and FCE effective August 26, 2019.
ollama_generated: "Memorandum of Understanding" shall refer to the non-enforceable accord reached by ExxonMobil and FCE on August 26, 2019, which may be freely terminated or amended by either party without prior notice.

original: “Milestone 2 ” is defined in the Definition Agreement.
ollama_generated: "The achievement of Milestone 2 shall be contingent upon the execution of the Definition Agreement."

original: “Policies ” are defined in Paragraph 17.01 (Business Standards).
ollama_generated:
"The term 'Policies,' as detailed in Paragraph 17.01 (Business Standards), shall be construed and understood by the parties involved."

This version is more collaborative and suggests that both parties are responsible for understanding the policies, rather than implying a clear obligation on one party to define them.

original: “Prior JDA Project Results ” means Project Results as defined in the Prior JDA, which by definition are jointly-owned by the Parties.
modified: "Prior JDA Project Results" shall denote such Project Results, as delineated within the Prior JDA and solely owned by each Party individually, with an understanding that neither Party grants exclusive rights to the other over these results."

original: Program Information specifically includes Program Inventions and Program Samples. Program Information also includes improvements to either Party’s Background Information conceived, created, developed or acquired in or for the Program and resulting directly from activities performed in the course of and as a result of working directly on the Program.
ollama_generated: The term "Program Information," encompasses not only Program Inventions and Program Samples, but also enhancements to either Party's Pre-existing Knowledge that are devised, developed, or acquired during the course of the Program and are directly attributed to activities carried out within the scope of the Program. It is important to note that this expansion of Program Information does not obligate either Party to disclose any such developments unless explicitly agreed upon in writing by both Parties.

original: “Program Inventions ” means Program Information that is characterized as inventions, discoveries, or improvements (whether patentable or not) that are conceived, created, developed, or acquired by or on behalf a Party or its Affiliates during the Term of this Agreement and one (1) year thereafter, and in the course of and as a result of working directly on the Program. Program Inventions shall also include Project Inventions (as defined in the Prior JDA) that have not been filed with any national, regional, or international patent body or organization by the Effective Date of this Agreement. Program Inventions shall be owned by ExxonMobil and its Affiliates.
modified:
"Covered Intellectual Property" refers to any intellectual property, including inventions, discoveries, or improvements (whether patentable or not), that emerge from the scope of the Program during the Term of this Agreement and a period of one (1) year thereafter, and are generated as a direct consequence of work undertaken under this agreement. It also encompasses Project Intellectual Property (as defined in the Prior JDA), which remains unsubmitted to any national, regional, or international patent office by the Effective Date of this Agreement. The ownership rights to the Covered Intellectual Property shall be retained exclusively by you, [Your Name or Company Name], and your Affiliates."

In this rewritten clause:
1. The obligation of ownership is shifted from ExxonMobil and its Affiliates to you or your company name.
2. The term "Program Inventions" is replaced with "Covered Intellectual Property", emphasizing a broader scope of intellectual property rights, not just inventions.
3. The meaning is slightly weakened by replacing the obligation to own Program Inventions with a retention of ownership for Covered Intellectual Property.
